title: Array Challenge
problem_statement:
Array Challenge

Have the function ArrayChallenge(arr) take the arr parameter being passed which will be an array of integers in the following format: [B, G, N] where B represents the number of boys, G represents the number of girls, and N represents how many people you want to pair together. Your program should return the number of different ways you can match boys with girls given the different arguments.

For example: if arr is [5, 3, 2], N=2 here so you want to pair together 2 people, so you\'ll need 1 boy and 1 girl. You have 5 ways to choose a boy and 3 ways to choose a girl, so your program should return 15.

Another example: if arr is [10, 5, 4], here N=4 so you need 2 boys and 2 girls. We can choose 2 boys from a possible 10, and we can choose 2 girls from a possible 5. Then we have 2 different ways to pair the chosen boys and girls. Our program should therefore return 900.

N will always be an even number and it will never be greater than the maximum of (B, G). B and G will always be greater than zero.

Input Format

An array of integers [B, G, N].

Output Format

An integer representing the number of different ways to match boys and girls.

Constraints

  • N is an even number.
  • N â‰¤ max(B, G).
  • B, G > 0.

Examples

Input:
{5, 5, 4}
Output:
200
Input:
{2, 2, 2}
Output:
4
